# position(from:offset:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the text position at a specified offset from another text position.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func position(from position: UITextPosition, offset: Int) -> UITextPosition?
```

## Parameters

- **position**: A custom [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextPosition] object that represents a location in a document.
- **offset**: A character offset from `position`. It can be a positive or negative value.

## Return Value

A custom [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextPosition] object that represents the location in a document that is at the specified offset from `position`. Return `nil` if the computed text position is less than 0 or greater than the length of the backing string.

## Discussion

For an example of an implementation of this method, see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/StringsTextFonts/Conceptual/TextAndWebiPhoneOS/CustomTextProcessing/CustomTextProcessing.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40009542-CH4] in [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/StringsTextFonts/Conceptual/TextAndWebiPhoneOS/Introduction/Introduction.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40009542].

## Computing text ranges and text positions

- **textRange(from:to:)**: Returns the range between two text positions.
- **position(from:in:offset:)**: Returns the text position at a specified offset in a specified direction from another text position.
- **beginningOfDocument**: The text position for the beginning of a document.
- **endOfDocument**: The text position for the end of a document.
